GameCore

Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameCore.GameLogic

  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains all the logic for the LightRacer game. Its main functionality are to update the player's position within the map,check for collision and update the pixel array used by GamePanel.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GameLogic getInstance()
        return a static instance of GameLogic and creates 2 new Players
        Returns:
        GameLogic a static instance of the GameLogic class

      • initializePlayers

        public void initializePlayers()
        Initialize players before each round. Sets player's initial position,sets the map and sets collision for both players to false.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the game by determining players new direction and position, the method movePlayers breaks if obstacle is detected. This method then proceeds to handle the collision by calling handleCollision method Finally, it will update the direction LinkedList for both players

      • renderScreen

        public void renderScreen(int[] pixels)
        This class takes in the Map array and converts them into pixels to be displayed on the screen. We first get each tiles in Map array and assign them to a ARGB int value. This will determine the type of the tile. Then we assign each pixels to be part of a tile
        Parameters:
        {@link - int[]} pixels

      • movePlayers

        public void movePlayers(java.util.LinkedList<Control> playerDirection,
               Player player,
               Map mapArray,
               java.lang.String trail,
               java.lang.String head)
        This functions determines the players new position based on the playerDirection LinkedList.
        The LinkedList contains the player's movement direction (NORTH,EAST,WEST,SOUTH).
        The method checks if there is an obstacle in the adjacent tile specified by the player's direction.
        If not it will modify the mapArray with updated values about the player's head position and tail. If obstacle is detected, the method breaks
        Parameters:
        {@link - LinkedList} playerDirection
        {@link - Player} player
        {@link - Map} mapArray
        {@link - String} trail
        {@link - String} head

      • getGameRoundNumber

        public static boolean hasCollided(Player player,
                  Map gameMap,
                  Coordinate nextLocation)
        Checks is player has collided with anything on the gameMap
        Returns:
        boolean

      • handleCollisions

        public boolean handleCollisions(Player player1,
                       Player player2)
        handleCollision will first check if there are any collision, and then handle them. If there are no collisions, then it will return false If there are collisions, then it will return true, update the GameScore and end the game
        Returns:
        boolean
